sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: These are the scenes that welcomed Ukrainian soldiers following the retreat of the Russian army from Bukha.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dead civilians, many with their hands tied behind their backs, littered the streets like garbage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Men and women, young and old, no reason and no compassion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The world is now reacting in horror at these latest images from the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President of the EU Council Charles Michel said he was shocked by the atrocities committed by the Russian army in Bukha. He said evidence of war crimes is being collected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia meanwhile deny responsibility for the killings, is being collected. Russia meanwhile deny responsibility for the killings, saying its units left the town on March 30th and evidence of crimes in Bukha appeared four days after.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In other liberated areas, Ukrainian officials are finding similar sites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The bodies of the head of the village of Maty Zin and her family were found in a rudimentary grave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There are fears other abducted leaders face similar fates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As of today, 11 heads of local communities from Kyiv, Kherson, Kharkiv, Zaporizhia, Mykolaiv and Donetsk regions are in captivity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Peace talks and news of Russian forces pulling back from Kyiv were resoundingly welcomed by all hoping to see an end to hostilities. But now the true horrors of war are being uncovered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thick black smoke covers the skies over Odessa. The port city has been mostly sheltered from Thick black smoke covers the skies over Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The port city has been mostly sheltered from the main thrust of the invasion, but now Russian forces are pointing their devastating missiles this way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At daybreak on Sunday, the inhabitants woke to sounds of explosions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Missiles struck an oil processing plant and fuel depot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Russian Defence Ministry says the facilities were used to provide fuel to the Ukrainian army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But for many, the bombs fell dangerously close to residential areas.

sentences.sentence: It was in the morning at 6 o'clock. People were still sleeping.

Euronews correspondent Sergio Ferreira de Almeida is on the ground in Odessa. He says, ''The explosions heard this morning and the extensive cloud of smoke we see behind me remind the residents of Odessa that the threat is very present, especially since there are 14 Russian warships with their guns pointed to land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Braving a surprise snowstorm, thousands of people in the Swiss capital Bern demand an end to Russia's war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Organisers say the main goal is to push Switzerland to actively engage in efforts to secure a ceasefire and a full withdrawal of Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russian oligarchs have their money here in Switzerland in Swiss banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So Switzerland is a key place to stop this war and the Swiss government must take this responsibility and freeze all the assets of Russian oligarchs who financed this bloody war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are here to demonstrate that we don't forget, that even here, far away from the conflict, we have a role to play and it's important to show it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Budapest, Ukrainian refugee mothers and their children rally one day before national elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Marching over Budapest's Elizabeth Bridge, demonstrators bring baby goods, stopping every so often to sing the Ukrainian national anthem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Incumbent Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban cast his vote in the country's general election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He's asking voters for a fourth consecutive term in office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Placed against him is a disparate, western-leaning coalition of six opposition parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the shadow of war in Ukraine, Orb√°n's opposition to sending direct military aid has become a major issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Because of the conflict, the issue of war and peace also became a part of this campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Our view is clear that we are on the side which guarantees peace and security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We see our opponents as dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We ask everyone to vote for those parties who are able to guarantee peace and security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many hope that this man could bring Orban's time in power to an end.

sentences.sentence: Peter Marquise heads the coalition to unseat the governing Fidesz party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While he's slightly behind in the polls, it's still a tight race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I would like to ask everyone to cast their vote with dignity, peace of mind. Everyone should take part in the vote. There's a real choice, not just a vote. For the first time in 12 years there's a real chance to change.

Many support Prime Minister Orban's call to largely stay out of the conflict, but the call from the opposition to help to arm the Ukrainians has gained ground too a huge victory that's what Serbia's leader is expecting for his party in the presidential election as voting begins on Sunday about 6.5 million voters will be choosing a new president, new parliament and local authorities for the capital Belgrade and other towns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We do expect a huge victory. That's what we worked for the last four or five years and we believe that we're going to continue with great efforts and of course with a great contribution to the development of this country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Opinion surveys have predicted that Vucic will win another five-year term and his right-wing Serbian Progressive Party will dominate the 250-member assembly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But analysts say opposition groups do stand a chance at winning the majority in Belgrade, a possible blow to the populists' decade-old unchallenged rule in Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Shame was the chant as the deputy speaker of Pakistan's parliament dissolved the chamber, setting the stage for early elections in the South Asian country of more than 200 million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Imran Khan asked Pakistan's president to make the move after he faced a no-confidence vote, which he was likely to lose.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: To justify circumventing the ballot, Khan accused the political opposition of working with the United States to overthrow his government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Washington has expressly denied this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A move to change the regime, an attempt against 22 million people and a no-confidence motion with a foreign agenda that was planned abroad was rejected. This betrayal was taking place in front of the entire nation. Traitors were sitting and were planning this conspiracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And in the capital Islamabad, the mood is tense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The recent political turmoil has led the security agencies to lock down the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Giant shipping containers block the entrance to the diplomatic quarter and other sensitive government buildings in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's war in Ukraine has reawakened interest in Switzerland's concrete nuclear fallout shelters built during the Cold War with enough space to shelter everyone in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Since the 1960s every Swiss municipality has had to build nuclear bunkers for their residents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
